definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: As a result, nightlife is one of the indispensable things in shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 因此，夜生活是上海必不可缺的一部分。
晚上11點，該去體驗下夜生活了。

sentences.english: The nightlife there is wonderful, too.
sentences.chinese: 那裏的夜生活也很精采。

sentences.english: Areas like Kabukicho offer an endless choice of nightlifedestinations.
sentences.chinese: 像歌舞伎町這樣的地方爲夜生活的提供了無盡的選擇。

sentences.english: Palm Springs has ritzy restaurants and glitzy nightlife.
sentences.chinese: 棕櫚泉有高檔的餐廳和奢華的夜生活。

sentences.english: so the nightlife is very expensive.
sentences.chinese: 所以這裏夜生活是非常昂貴的。

sentences.english: A lot of people say that Tokyo nightlife can be regarded among the craziest districts all over the globe.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都說東京夜生活是全球各地最瘋狂的。

sentences.english: Can you tell us about the nightlife in Camden?
sentences.chinese: 你可以給我們講講卡姆登的夜生活嗎？

sentences.english: Straightaway, photos of her nightlife dominated my news feed.
sentences.chinese: 她的夜生活照片直接成爲我信息流的主要內容。

sentences.english: Dana: Which one has better nightlife?
sentences.chinese: 哪個城市的夜生活更好玩？

sentences.english: Can you tell us about your nightlife?
sentences.chinese: 能跟我們講講你的夜生活嗎？

sentences.english: The night life in Xian has a unique glamour.
sentences.chinese: 西安的夜生活具有獨特的魅力。

sentences.english: The island of Sicily and the peninsula are shining lights of the city nightlife.
sentences.chinese: 西西里島的島嶼和半島都閃爍着城市夜生活燈光。

sentences.english: Can you tell us about the nightlife in Tribeca?
sentences.chinese: 能跟我們講講你在特里貝克的夜生活嗎？

sentences.english: But you saw something of the nightlife?
sentences.chinese: 感受過這裏的夜生活吧？

sentences.english: Elsewhere, DeLinda escorts her sheepishly innocent Amish cousin as he sows his oats on the Vegas strip before returning to the simple life.
sentences.chinese: 狄蓮娜因表弟到訪帶他觀摩拉斯維加斯的夜生活。

definition: to spend time in a bar (alcohol, Internet etc)/to go clubbing
lanterns red, wine green (idiom); feasting and pleasure-seeking/debauched and corrupt environment
early evening when lanterns are first lit
to eat, drink and be merry (idiom)/to abandon oneself to a life of pleasure
disco/night club/abbr. for 迪斯科廳|迪斯科厅
